trans-unit.source: Checks if a string is a floating point number.

seg-source.mrk: Checks if a string is a floating point number.

target.mrk: Checks if a string is a floating point number.

seg-source.mrk: Parameters

target.mrk: Parameters

trans-unit.source: The string or expression to check.

seg-source.mrk: The string or expression to check.

target.mrk: The string or expression to check.

seg-source.mrk: Return Value

target.mrk: Return Value

seg-source.mrk: 0 if not floating point format.

target.mrk: 0 if not floating point format.

seg-source.mrk: Remarks

target.mrk: Remarks

trans-unit.source: A string is a float if it contains at least one decimal digit and exactly one period; the only other character allowed is an optional plus or minus at the beginning. (StringIsFloat() does not accept a comma character as the decimal point even if the computer Locale settings use that symbol.) If parameter is not a string, its value is converted to a string. See examples.

seg-source.mrk: A string is a float if it contains at least one decimal digit and exactly one period; the only other character allowed is an optional plus or minus at the beginning.
(StringIsFloat() does not accept a comma character as the decimal point even if the computer Locale settings use that symbol.)
If parameter is not a string, its value is converted to a string.
See examples.

target.mrk: A string is a float if it contains at least one decimal digit and exactly one period; the only other character allowed is an optional plus or minus at the beginning.
(StringIsFloat() does not accept a comma character as the decimal point even if the computer Locale settings use that symbol.)
If parameter is not a string, its value is converted to a string.
See examples.

trans-unit.source: Returns 0, as the string 3 / (forward slash) 4 is not a floating point number.

seg-source.mrk: Returns 0, as the string 3 / (forward slash) 4 is not a floating point number.

target.mrk: Returns 0, as the string 3 / (forward slash) 4 is not a floating point number.

trans-unit.source: Is the number 1.0 a floating point number:

seg-source.mrk: Is the number 1.0 a floating point number:

target.mrk: Is the number 1.0 a floating point number:

trans-unit.source: Returns 1, due to the number to string conversion as well as the decimal point.

seg-source.mrk: Returns 1, due to the number to string conversion as well as the decimal point.

target.mrk: Returns 1, due to the number to string conversion as well as the decimal point.
